keywhiz

Class KeywhizConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dropwizard.Configuration
      • keywhiz.KeywhizConfig

  • public class KeywhizConfig
extends io.dropwizard.Configuration
    Keywhiz app-level configuration. Ensures validation of entire configuration at startup.

      • getEnvironment

        public String getEnvironment()

      • getDataSourceFactory

        public io.dropwizard.db.DataSourceFactory getDataSourceFactory()
        Customizes the database config when requested. If the username for the database is not set, the current user is set as the username.
        Returns:
        DatabaseConfiguration for read/write database.

      • getReadonlyDataSourceFactory

        public io.dropwizard.db.DataSourceFactory getReadonlyDataSourceFactory()
        Customizes the database config when requested. If the username for the database is not set, the current user is set as the username.
        Returns:
        DatabaseConfiguration for readonly database.

      • getMigrationsDir

        public String getMigrationsDir()
        Customizes the migrations directory. The content of the directory might vary depending on the database engine. Having it configurable is useful.
        Returns:
        path relative to the resources directory.

      • getUserAuthenticatorFactory

        public UserAuthenticatorFactory getUserAuthenticatorFactory()
        Returns:
        LDAP configuration to authenticate admin users. Absent if fakeLdap is true.

      • getAlternateUiPath

        public Optional<String> getAlternateUiPath()
        Returns:
        Enables loading UI assets from a directory instead of resource.

      • getSessionCookieConfig

        public CookieConfig getSessionCookieConfig()
        Returns:
        Configuration for authenticating session cookie provided by admin login.

      • getXsrfCookieConfig

        public CookieConfig getXsrfCookieConfig()
        Returns:
        Configuration for cross-site request forgery (XSRF) prevention cookie. Admin clients must set an XSRF header for requests with the value of this cookie.

      • getCookieKey

        @NotNull
 @ValidBase64
 @Length(min=44,
        max=44)
public String getCookieKey()
        Returns:
        Base64-encoded key used to encrypt authenticating cookies.
